definition: using the weak to defeat the strong (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Is a big victory over the American Revolutionary War, the typical David and Goliath wars.
sentences.chinese: 美國獨立戰爭是以小勝大，以弱勝強的典型戰例。
